data.meanings: to be saleable, to come out of a hole, be exhausted (store), consumed, spent, expenditure. To enter into another hole where there is another outlet, so is a hypocrite who professes to believe first one thing and then another, thus entering faith through one door and leaving it through another.nafaqan (n.acc.) hole with another outlet, tunnel.nafaqatun (n.) worthy to be spent, expenditure.nafaqu (prt. 3rd p. m. plu. III) practised hypocrisy.nafaqa (v.) to profess hypocrisy, believe in one thing and then another.munafiqun (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqin (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqat (f. plu. III) hypocrite womennifaq (v. n. III) hypocrisynifaqan (v. n. III acc.) hypocrisyanfaqa (perf. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) he had spentanfaqta (perf. 2nd p. m. sing. IV) thou hath spent.anfaqu (perf. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) they have spentanfaqtum (perf. 2nd p. m. plu. IV) Ye have spentyunfiqu (imp. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) spendstunfiquna (imp. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) Ye spendtunfiqu (imp. 2nd p. m. plu. IV acc.) Ye spendanfiqu prt. m. plu. IV) spendinfaq (v. n. ) spendingmunfiqina (m. plu.) those who spend
data.sentence: The word يُنْفِقُونَ comes from the root ن ف ق and is associated with the meanings: to be saleable, to come out of a hole, be exhausted (store), consumed, spent, expenditure. To enter into another hole where there is another outlet, so is a hypocrite who professes to believe first one thing and then another, thus entering faith through one door and leaving it through another.nafaqan (n.acc.) hole with another outlet, tunnel.nafaqatun (n.) worthy to be spent, expenditure.nafaqu (prt. 3rd p. m. plu. III) practised hypocrisy.nafaqa (v.) to profess hypocrisy, believe in one thing and then another.munafiqun (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqin (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqat (f. plu. III) hypocrite womennifaq (v. n. III) hypocrisynifaqan (v. n. III acc.) hypocrisyanfaqa (perf. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) he had spentanfaqta (perf. 2nd p. m. sing. IV) thou hath spent.anfaqu (perf. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) they have spentanfaqtum (perf. 2nd p. m. plu. IV) Ye have spentyunfiqu (imp. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) spendstunfiquna (imp. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) Ye spendtunfiqu (imp. 2nd p. m. plu. IV acc.) Ye spendanfiqu prt. m. plu. IV) spendinfaq (v. n. ) spendingmunfiqina (m. plu.) those who spend

data.meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.
data.sentence: The word النَّاسِ comes from the root ن و س and is associated with the meanings: to swing, halt in a place, move, toss. Mankind, people, others, men.

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word وَاللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.
data.sentence: The word الْمُحْسِنِينَ comes from the root ح س ن and is associated with the meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.

data.meanings: glad/delight/happiness/joy/rejoice. sarra - to speak secretly, divulge a secret, manifest a secret. secret, heart, conscience, marriage, origin, choice part, mystery, in private, to conceal/reveal/manifest. sarir - couch/throne.
data.sentence: The word السَّرَّاءِ comes from the root س ر ر and is associated with the meanings: glad/delight/happiness/joy/rejoice. sarra - to speak secretly, divulge a secret, manifest a secret. secret, heart, conscience, marriage, origin, choice part, mystery, in private, to conceal/reveal/manifest. sarir - couch/throne.

data.meanings: To shut, stop, abstract, suppress one’s anger, choke, tight or fill something with a check, abstain from chewing the end.
data.sentence: The word وَالْكَاظِمِينَ comes from the root ك ظ م and is associated with the meanings: To shut, stop, abstract, suppress one’s anger, choke, tight or fill something with a check, abstain from chewing the end.

data.meanings: anger, wrath, rage, vehemence, distress; cooking-pot
data.sentence: The word الْغَيْظَ comes from the root غ ي ظ and is associated with the meanings: anger, wrath, rage, vehemence, distress; cooking-pot

data.meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
data.sentence: The word وَالْعَافِينَ comes from the root ع ف و and is associated with the meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
